Greg,

> We have 2 "AllTests" classes for each package in our system, one that 
> has DB tests and one for everything else. Then we have 2 corresponding 
> system-level "AllTests" classes that encompass all the package-
> level "AllTest" classes. Is there an easy and reliabe way to keep 
> these "AllTest" classes up to date? It's hard enough to get everyone 
> to write tests, but now they also have to remember to update the 
> appropriate "AllTests" classes any time they create a new test class. 
> I hoping there's a pattern or JUnit extension or something that will 
> help with this. Any advice would be greatly appreciated.

Our project has a similar structure. A couple of months ago I asked the 
listserve about the usefulness of a custom XDoclet task that would build 
these AllTests class automatically. The list's consensus is that there 
isn't an existing tool to do that, but that such a tool wouldn't be 
entirely useful because there are classes that can do this on the fly, 
such as the JUnit Addons' ArchiveSuiteBuilder 
[http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/junitx/util/ArchiveSuiteBuilder.html]. 
But since that's not what you (or I) are looking for, the XDoclet 
approach sounds more realistic. I can't send you what I've written, but 
I'd be happy to point you in the right direction for writing such a task 
yourself.
